intro: Didymochlaena lunulata var. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved moon-leaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually less than 2 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, often appearing in late spring to early summer. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including regions of Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
